channel.title: (server sided)7 error adding new hitmarks (PI)
channel.description:
src\server\model\players\Player.java:27: error: illegal forward reference public int maxHp = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); ^ src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:350: error: method handleHitMask i n class Player cannot be applied to given types; c.handleHitMask(c.playerLevel[3]/10); ^ required: int,int,int found: int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:1144 : error: method handleHitMask in class Player cannot be applied to given types; c.handleHitMask(c.playerLevel[3]/10); ^ required: int,int,int found: int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:1444 : error: method handleHitMask in class Player cannot be applied to given types; Server.playerHandler.players[playerId].h andleHitMask(damage); ^ required: int,int,int found: int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:1657 : error: method handleHitMask in class Player cannot be applied to given types; Server.playerHandler.players[i].handleHitMask(damage); ^ required: int,int,int found: int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:4234 : error: method handleHitMask in class Player cannot be applied to given types; o.handleHitMask(damage); ^ required: int,int,int found: int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:2046: error: method handleHitMask in class Player cannot be applied to given types; c.handleHitMask(damage); ^ required: int,int,int found: int reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors
searched on javas site for those errors explanations and didn't understood.. would be nice if somebody could help :$
logic from r-s told me something that i had to add numbers? [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/help/508424-server-sided-8-error-adding-new-hitmarks-pi.html#post4152353]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/help/508424-server-sided-8-error-adding-new-hitmarks-pi.html#post4152353[/url]
thats the tut i followed: [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/387997-pi-hitmarks-fading-floating-critical.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/387997-pi-hitmarks-fading-floating-critical.html[/url]

item.title: (server sided)7 error adding new hitmarks (PI)
item.dc:creator: @poutine8775 poutine8775
item.description:
@poutine8775 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:529111”][quote]src\server\model\players\Player.java:27: error: illegal forward reference
public int maxHp = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
[/quote]
getLevelForXP is being called before it’s declared. Move the method that’s calling it down lower.

[quote]src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:1219: error: method dealDamage in
class Player cannot be applied to given types;
Server.playerHandler.players.dealDamage(damag
e, 0, 0);
^
required: int
found: int,int,int
reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length
src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:1360: error: method dealDamage in
class Player cannot be applied to given types;
Server.playerHandler.players.dealDama
ge(damage, 0, 0);
^
required: int
found: int,int,int
reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length
src\server\model\players\CombatAssistant.java:1448: error: method dealDamage in
class Player cannot be applied to given types;
Server.playerHandler.players[playerId].d
ealDamage(damage, 0, 0);
^
required: int
found: int,int,int
reason: actual and formal argument lists differ in length[/quote]
Has 3 ints, you only need 1.[/quote]

thank you very much but tried to put public int maxHp = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); at the end of public ints still not work… i’ll retry

Read full topic

item.title: (server sided)7 error adding new hitmarks (PI)
item.dc:creator: @poutine8775 poutine8775
item.description:
@poutine8775 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:529111”]o.handleHitMask(damage);
Has 1 int.
You need:
o.handleHitMask(damage, 0, 0);

0 and 0 may not be right (I’m pretty sure it’s not. But that shows you have enough ints…[/quote]

oh i see thank you this work but what about this one c.handleHitMask(c.playerLevel[3]/10);

and also this one public int maxHp = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

o.handleHitMask(damage);
Has 1 int.
You need:
o.handleHitMask(damage, 0, 0);

0 and 0 may not be right (I’m pretty sure it’s not. But that shows you have enough ints…
